title: The Five Dysfunctions of a Team
description: A 60-second lesson on The Five Dysfunctions of a Team.

hook.text: Patrick Lencioni says most teams fail not from lack of talent but from five predictable dysfunctions.

discovery.text: Each dysfunction feeds the next. Without trust, people avoid honest conflict. Without conflict, decisions lack buy-in.

twist.text: The hardest step is the first: building vulnerability-based trust where people admit mistakes and weaknesses.

climax.text: Teams that master all five levels consistently outperform teams with more talent but worse dynamics.

punchline.text: Fix trust first. Everything else is built on top of it.
